rhythmSections.title: Ballad
rhythmSections.description: Slow, emotional tempo with gentle strumming patterns

rhythmSections.title: Mid Tempo
rhythmSections.description: Moderate pace with balanced rhythm patterns

rhythmSections.title: Slow Tempo
rhythmSections.description: Relaxed tempo focusing on chord transitions

tests.title: 1. Fingerboard Knowledge
tests.description:
You will be asked to name notes on specific strings and frets.

Learn the natural notes (A‚ÄìG) up to the 5th fret on each string.
Be confident in identifying open strings and simple fretted notes.

tests.title: 2. Clarity and Fluency
tests.description:
Focus on producing clear and even notes.

Keep your fretting-hand fingers close to the frets using the tips of your fingers. Avoid unwanted string noise by muting unplayed strings.

When picking, use smooth downstrokes and consistent motion.

tests.title: 3. Knowledge of the Instrument
tests.description:
Understand basic parts of the guitar:
‚Ä¢ Headstock ‚Äì holds tuning pegs
‚Ä¢ Neck and fingerboard ‚Äì where notes are fretted
‚Ä¢ Body ‚Äì resonates the sound
‚Ä¢ Frets ‚Äì divide the neck into semitone steps
‚Ä¢ Bridge ‚Äì anchors strings to the body

Know how to tune your guitar and identify marker dots.

tests.title: 4. Basic Functions on an Amplifier
tests.description:
You should know what each basic control does:
‚Ä¢ Volume ‚Äì controls loudness
‚Ä¢ Tone ‚Äì adjusts brightness or warmth
‚Ä¢ Gain ‚Äì adds drive or distortion

Example questions:
‚Ä¢ What happens when you increase the gain?
‚Ä¢ What does the tone knob do?

tests.title: Clap Back a Rhythm
tests.description: Examiner plays a short rhythm (2 bars in 4/4). You listen, then clap it back in time. Focus on steady pulse and accurate rhythm

tests.title: Repetition of Melodic Phrases
tests.subtitle: Based on the scales from the Scale Section

rhythmSections.title: Bright And Lively
rhythmSections.description: Smooth, steady strumming with simple accents

rhythmSections.title: Tenderly
rhythmSections.description: Relaxed strumming focusing on clean chord changes

rhythmSections.title: Moderate Tempo
rhythmSections.description: Energetic rhythm using consistent down-up motion

tests.title: 1. Fingerboard Knowledge
tests.description: The examiner names a string and fret ‚Äî you must name the note. Be familiar with the scales used in Component 1.

2. Clarity & Fluency.title: 2. Clarity & Fluency
2. Clarity & Fluency.description:
Fretting-hand positioning: keep fingers close to frets using fingertip.

Fluency when picking: use alternate picking (down-up) smoothly, avoid too much or too little pick showing.

3. Knowledge of the Instrument.title: 3. Knowledge of the Instrument
3. Knowledge of the Instrument.description:
Understand how tone changes with hand position or pickup selection.

Know the machine heads (tuners), action (string height), marker dots (position guides), nut, and saddle.

4. Controls on an Amplifier.title: 4. Controls on an Amplifier
4. Controls on an Amplifier.description:
Understand volume vs gain relationship, and bass/mid/treble controls.

Know what the standby switch does (valve amps).

Example questions:
‚Ä¢ How to set gain high but volume low.
‚Ä¢ Name two types of amp (valve, transistor, modelling, hybrid).

videos.title: Grade 3, lead guitar in C minor
Grade 3, lead in D flat major

tests.title: 1. Fingerboard Knowledge
tests.description:
You will be asked to name notes on particular strings and frets taken from scales in Component 1.

Continue expanding your knowledge of the entire fretboard. Be confident naming all natural notes up to the 12th fret on each string.

tests.title: 2. Clarity and Fluency
tests.description:
You may be asked about optimum hand positioning and fluency when playing:

‚Ä¢ Keep fingers close to the frets, pressing with fingertips.
‚Ä¢ Maintain relaxed wrist and thumb placement.
‚Ä¢ Use alternate picking for consistent tone.
‚Ä¢ Control unwanted noise by muting unused strings.

Fluency develops through even tone and rhythm‚Äîaccuracy is more important than speed.

tests.title: 3. Knowledge of the Instrument
tests.description:
You may be asked about key parts of the guitar and their functions:
‚Ä¢ Headstock ‚Äì holds the tuning machines
‚Ä¢ Nut ‚Äì spaces the strings evenly
‚Ä¢ Frets ‚Äì divide the fingerboard into semitones
‚Ä¢ Bridge and saddle ‚Äì support the strings and define vibration length
‚Ä¢ Marker dots ‚Äì guide visual positioning at frets 3, 5, 7, 9, and 12

Also understand how string tension and action affect playability.

tests.title: 4. Types of Effects Pedals
tests.description:
You should understand the main categories of effects pedals and their functions:

üé∏ **Overdrive / Distortion / Fuzz** ‚Äì Add gain and saturation for more aggressive tones.
üéöÔ∏è **Filter Effects** ‚Äì Wah or envelope filter alter tone by emphasizing frequency ranges.
üéõÔ∏è **Modulation Effects** ‚Äì Chorus, flanger, phaser; add movement and depth.
‚è±Ô∏è **Delay & Reverb** ‚Äì Create echo or spatial ambience, making the sound larger or more atmospheric.

You may be asked to describe how each affects the tone or to identify the type of sound they produce.
